about.name: Maldives
about.info_text: The Maldives is a tropical paradise located in the Indian Ocean, southwest of Sri Lanka. It is renowned for its stunning white-sand beaches, crystal-clear turquoise waters, and vibrant coral reefs. Comprising 26 atolls and over a thousand coral islands, the Maldives is a popular destination for honeymooners, scuba divers, and beach lovers. Visitors can enjoy overwater bungalows, water sports, snorkeling, and experience the unique underwater world in this idyllic island nation. The Maldives offers a serene and luxurious escape surrounded by the beauty of the Indian Ocean.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 520,000
Official Language: Dhivehi
Currency: Maldivian Rufiyaa (MVR)
Time Zone: Maldives Standard Time (MST, UTC+05:00)
Climate: Tropical climate with a dry northeast monsoon (November to March) and a wet southwest monsoon (April to October).

attractions_card.title: Underwater Restaurants
attractions_card.description: Experience dining in underwater restaurants where you can enjoy a meal while observing the rich marine life of the Indian Ocean.

attractions_card.title: Water Villas
attractions_card.description: Stay in luxurious overwater bungalows offering direct access to the crystal-clear waters, and breathtaking views of the ocean.

attractions_card.title: Coral Reefs
attractions_card.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs through snorkeling and scuba diving to witness a variety of marine species and colorful corals.

attractions_card.alt: Manta Ray and Whale Shark Watching
attractions_card.title: Manta Ray and Whale Shark Watching
attractions_card.description: The Maldives is a hotspot for watching manta rays and whale sharks, offering thrilling encounters with these gentle giants.

attractions_card.title: Local Islands
attractions_card.description: Visit local Maldivian islands to experience the culture, traditions, and interact with friendly locals.

attractions_card.title: Male, the Capital
attractions_card.description: Explore the capital city, Male, with its colorful buildings, bustling markets, and historical landmarks.

attractions_card.title: Water Sports
attractions_card.description: Enjoy a range of water sports, including windsurfing, parasailing, and jet skiing, in the pristine waters of the Maldives.

attractions_card.title: Island Hopping
attractions_card.description: Embark on island-hopping adventures to discover the unique charm of different Maldivian islands.

food_card.title: Maldivian Cuisine
food_card.description: Savor traditional Maldivian dishes, including fish curry, coconut-based curries, and sweet treats like bondi (fried dough).

food_card.title: Fresh Seafood
food_card.description: Enjoy the freshest seafood, from grilled fish to lobster, served at beachside restaurants with a view.

food_card.title: International Cuisine
food_card.description: Indulge in international cuisine, with many resorts offering a variety of dining options, from Italian to Japanese.

food_card.title: Beachside Dining
food_card.description: Dine on the beach under the starry sky, with the sound of the waves and your toes in the sand.

food_card.title: Tropical Fruits
food_card.description: Taste a wide array of tropical fruits, including coconuts, papayas, and mangos, available throughout the Maldives.

hotels_card.title: Luxury Resorts
hotels_card.description: Stay in luxurious resorts with overwater bungalows and world-class amenities, offering a private and romantic experience.

hotels_card.title: Mid-Range Accommodations
hotels_card.description: Find comfortable mid-range accommodations that provide value and convenience for travelers.

hotels_card.title: Budget-Friendly Options
hotels_card.description: Budget-conscious travelers can choose from guesthouses and affordable beachfront lodges.

hotels_card.title: Eco-Friendly Stays
hotels_card.description: Experience eco-friendly accommodations that promote sustainable tourism and responsible travel.

transport_card.title: Ibrahim Nasir International Airport
transport_card.description: The primary international airport in the Maldives, providing access to various atolls and resorts.

transport_card.title: Speedboats and Seaplanes
transport_card.description: Transfers to resorts are often by speedboat or seaplane, offering breathtaking aerial views of the islands.

transport_card.title: Domestic Flights
transport_card.description: Inter-island domestic flights are available for convenient travel between different atolls and islands.

transport_card.title: Ferries
transport_card.description: Ferry services connect various local islands and provide opportunities for island hopping.

transport_card.title: Water Taxis
transport_card.description: Water taxis are commonly used for short transfers within atolls and between neighboring islands.
